abstract.title: Overview
abstract.para: jPrint is a multi-modality print manager and server which can be used to connect any one of a wide variety of paper printers to a DICOM v3.0 network. The system can simultaneously receive images and associated printing parameters from multiple imaging scanners and reviewing workstations, while automatically transferring image data and instructions to connected paper printers.
Before sending the images to be printed, jPrint will apply image processing, using presentation parameters and a LUT to improve the image presentation quality and consistency.
jPrint supports the IHE Consistent Presentation of Images Integration Profile as the IHE Print Server Actor and the IHE Basic Security Integration Profile as an IHE Secure Node Actor.

jPrint supports following network services:NETWORK SERVICES
Networking SOP ClassesUser of Service (SCU)Provider of Service (SCP)
Print Management
Basic Grayscale Print Management MetaNoYes
Basic Color Print Management MetaNoYes
Presentation LUTNoYes
Basic AnnotationNoYes
Connectivity Verification
VerificationNoYes

section.title: Audience
section.para: This document is intended for hospital staff, health system integrators, software designers or implementers. It is assumed that the reader has a working understanding of DICOM.

section.title: Remarks
section.para: DICOM, by itself, does not guarantee interoperability. However, the Conformance Statement facilitates a first-level validation for interoperability between different applications supporting the same DICOM functionality.
This Conformance Statement is not intended to replace validation with other DICOM equipment to ensure proper exchange of information intended.

The scope of this Conformance Statement is to facilitate communication with TIANI and other vendors' medical equipment. The Conformance Statement should be read and understood in conjunction with the DICOM Standard [DICOM]. However, by itself it is not guaranteed to ensure the desired interoperability and successful interconnectivity with existing DICOM systems.
The user should be aware of the following important issues:

listitem.para: The comparison of different conformance statements is the first step towards assessing interconnectivity between TIANI and non-TIANI equipment.
Test procedures should be defined to validate the desired level of connectivity.

The DICOM standard will evolve to meet the users' future requirements. TIANI is actively involved in developing the standard further and therefore reserves the right to make changes to its products or to discontinue its delivery.

section.title: Definitions, Terms and Abbreviations
section.para: Definitions, terms and abbreviations used in this document are defined within the different parts of the DICOM standard.

Abbreviations and terms are as follows:AE
Application EntityAET
AE TitleDICOM
Digital Imaging and Communications in MedicineDIMSE
DICOM Message Service ElementGSDF
Grayscale Standard Display FunctionHIS/RIS
Hospital Information System / Radiology Information System.IHE
Integrating the Healthcare EnterpriseIHE-TF
Integrating the Healthcare Enterprise Technical FrameworkIOD
Information Object DefinitionISO
International Standard OrganizationPDU
DICOM Protocol Data UnitLUT
Look-up TableP-LUT
Presentation Look-up TableSCP
Service Class ProviderSCU
Service Class UserSOP
DICOM Service-Object PairTCP/IP
Transmission Control Protocol/Internet ProtocolTLS
Transport Layer SecurityUID
Unique IdentifierVR
Value Representation

listitem.para: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM), NEMA PS 3.1- 3.16, 2001
Integrating the Healthcare Enterprise Technical Framework, HIMSS/RSNA, Revision 5.4, 2002

section.title: Application Data Flow
section.para: jPrint consists of one server application and several calibration and configuration utilities. User interactions are only needed for the initial configuration of jPrint and regular calibration of any connected Printers. The server application is usually configured to run as Windows NT/2000/XP or Unix Startup Service.
jPrint uses the DICOM Basic Print Management Meta SOP Class to receive studies for printing on connected paper printers. Multiple associations to Print SCUs are supported.

jPrint receives the Images with the Presentation and Annotation information which is applied to the images, creating a print-job within the print queue. The print job contains one or more film pages composed from images selected by the client Print SCU.

section.title: Functional Definition of jPrint Application Entity
section.para: jPrint acquires the images and presentation information from the connected Print Composer (SCU). Studies are temporarily stored on disk. The images are then processed and formatted and finally send as a print-job to the connected printer(s).
If several printers are connected to jPrint, each printer is addressable by the Print SCU via a different Called AET.

If several Print Composers (SCU) request printing on the same printer simultaneously, jPrint will serialize the requests; the printer itself receives one print-job at a time from it's queue. If the number of print-jobs within the printer queue exceeds a configurable limit, jPrint defers the transmission of further print-jobs to the printer, until the number of print-jobs within the queue decreases below this limit.

If the printer is operating normally, then the pages described in the print-job will be printed. Changes in the printer operation status will be detected and can be queried by the Print SCU using the N-GET service of the Printer SOP Class at any time.

To achieve best hard copy presentation quality and consistency, the connected Printers must be calibrated at regular intervals. jPrint supports calibration by manual measurements using a gray scale densitometer or semi-automatic calibration, that only requires the user to scan a current gray scale print-out of the printer and a reference gray scale page, placing the resulting JPEG files into a configuration folder. The jPrint Service Manual describes the jPrint calibration of connected printers to the DICOM GSDF curve in detail.
jPrint includes:

section.title: Sequencing of Real-World Activities
section.para: Before any actual (gray scale) printing is performed, connected printers shall be calibrated. Otherwise jPrint cannot achieve conformance to printing consistency described by the DICOM Grayscale Standard Display Function (GSDF):Printer Calibration

The sequence of DICOM services used by the Print Composer (SCU) to send the images and presentation information to a Print Server (SCP) is specified in DICOM Part 4, Annex H. The Print SCU may invoke a print request for every page, by using the N-ACTION service of the Film Box SOP class:Film Box Print Request with P-LUT
jPrint also supports Print Requests on the Film Session level:Film Session Print Request with P-LUT
The Print Composer may query the Printer Status using N-GET of the Printer SOP Class any time it is needed during the Print sequence:Query Printer Status

section.title: General
section.para: The DICOM standard application context name for DICOM 3.0 is always accepted:

table.title: DICOM application context name for jPrint AE

section.title: Number of Associations
section.para: jPrint will accept up to 10 simultaneous delivery Associations:

table.title: Number of Associations accepted for jPrint AE

section.title: Asynchronous Nature
section.para: jPrint does not support asynchronous communication. Multiple outstanding transactions are not supported. It allows up to one invoked and one performed operation on an Association (it is synchronous).Asynchronous mode of operation is not supported.

table.title: Asynchronous Nature as SCP for jPrint AE

row.entry: Maximum number of outstanding asynchronous transactions

section.title: Implementation Identifying Information
section.para: The implementation information for this Application Entity is:

table.title: DICOM Implementation Class and Version for jPrint AE

section.title: Association Initiation Policy
section.para: This application entity never initiates associations.

section.title: Description and Sequencing of Activities
section.para: A remote peer DICOM Application Entity, acting as an Print SCU, establishes an association with jPrint that accepts these Associations for the purpose of receiving images and image presentation related data for image processing and printing on the connected paper printer, associated with the Called AET used in the association request by the Print SCU.

In the default configuration any Calling AET and any Called AET will be accepted. But if no printer is associated with the Called AET, only a Presentation Context for the Verification SOP Class will be accepted and the SCU can only verify the DICOM Association, but cannot invoke any print related DICOM service.
When an association has been established the Sequencing of Real-World Activities is as described in .
Association requests can be rejected with the following status codes and reasons:

table.title: Association Rejection Reasons

row.entry: The (configurable) maximum number of simultaneous associations has been reached. An association request with the same parameters may succeed at a later time.

section.title: Accepted Presentation Contexts
section.para: The accepted Presentation Contexts depends on the configuration for the paper printer associated with the Called AET in the association Request:

table.title: Accepted Presentation Contexts for Print Server Management

row.entry: Basic Grayscale Print Management Meta SOP (configurable)
Basic Color Print Management Meta SOP Class (configurable)

section.para: jPrint AE will prefer to accept the Explicit VR Little Endian Transfer Syntax if multiple transfer syntaxes are offered.
If no printer is associated with the Called AET, jPrint will only accept the Presentation Context for the Verification SOP Class.

section.title: Film Session SOP Class Operations for N-ACTION
section.para: The receipt of the N-ACTION will result in submitting a print job to print all the films of the film session in the order that they were received.

jPrint defines two Annotation Display Formats in the default configuration:Predefined Annotation Display Formats
IDLayoutAnnotation PositionDefault Content
TITLEPrints a centered text string in a larger font at the top, and four text strings in smaller fonts at the corners of the page.1: Top CenterDefault Title
2: Top Left$SESSION_LABEL$
3: Top Rightprinted by $CALLED_AET$ at $DATE$ $TIME$
4: Bottom Left$LICENSE_CN$\nvalid until $LICENSE_ENDDATE$
5: Bottom Right$PAGE$ of $PAGES$
NO_TITLEPrints only the four text strings in smaller fonts at the corners of the page.1: Top Left$SESSION_LABEL$
2: Top Rightprinted at $DATE$ $TIME$
3: Bottom Left$LICENSE_CN$\nvalid until $LICENSE_ENDDATE$
4: Bottom Right$PAGE$ of $PAGES$

The annotation display format also defines default contents for the created Annotation Boxes, which is printed if the Print SCU does not set the content of the box using the N-SET service of the Basic Annotation Box SOP Class.
The layout of the two predefined Annotation Display Formats may be modified and additional Annotation Display Formats may be defined by jPrint configuration files as well.
A Print SCU can control which Presentation LUT is applied by jPrint for Printing via the Configuration Information value:

table.title: Configuration Information Syntax

row.entry: Treats received pixel values as P-Values and perform gray scaling according the DICOM Grayscale Standard Standard Display Function (GSDF).
Apply Presentation LUT with linear optical density over the range of Min Density (2010,0120) and Max Density (2010,1030).

Apply pre-configured P-LUT loaded from conf/lut/<plut-name>.lut . As example, a Philips Standard LUT conf/lut/PHILIPS.lut is provided by the default configuration. Additional local P-LUTs may be defined by additonal P-LUT configuration files in conf/lut/.

Apply gamma-shaped P-LUT with gamma=<g>. Gamma > 1 increase the contrast in the dark and brighten the image as a whole. Gamma < 1 increase the contrast for bright pixel values and darken the image as a whole.

Apply S-shape LUT which enhances the contrast around a specified center=<c>. E.g., center=0.5 specifies the center of contrast enhancement in the middle, center=0.25 at 25%, center=0.75 at 75% of the pixel value range. slope=<s> specifies the grade of enhancement: E.g, slope=2 approximately double, slope=3 triple, the contrast aorund the specified center; slope=1 only minimal enhances the contrast, and slope=0 generates a linear LUT, independent of center=XX.
Apply S-shape LUT with additional gamma characteristic. gamma=1 applies the same LUT as with pure "center=<c>,slope=<s>"; slope=<0> applies the same LUT as with pure "gamma=<g>".

note.para: The selection of (jPrint) local P-LUTs via the Configuration Information value is automatically disabled, if the Print Composer (SCU) makes use of the DICOM Presentation LUT SOP Class. The described mechanism should only be used for printing from Print SCUs without P-LUT support!

section.para:
Providing a value for the Requested Resolution ID attribute, a Print SCU can select the resolution at which images on the page are to be printed. At default configuration, jPrint supports the two Resolution IDs defined by DICOM. The specified printer resolution values must be adjusted to the supported print resolutions of any connected printers:Predefined Resolution IDs
IDResolution
STANDARD600x600dpi
HIGH1200x1200dpi
Also, additional Resolution IDs may be defined in jPrint's configuration files.

note.para: jPrint does NOT support printing with non-squared printer resolution!
jPrint does NOT support printing of several pages with different Resolution IDs in one print job (=invoked by one Basic Film Session N-ACTION DIMSE).

FailureInvalid attribute value0106HAn invalid attribute value was submitted

FailureDuplicate SOP Instance0111HAn instance of the Basic Film Box SOP Class already exists
FailureInvalid Object Instance0117HCannot create Film Box without Film Session
FailureMissing Attribute0120HMandatory attribute missing

section.title: Specific Conformance for Grayscale Image Box SOP Class
section.para: jPrint provides the following support for the attributes contained in the N-SET DIMSE Service of the Basic Grayscale Image Box SOP Class:

table.title: Basic Grayscale Image Box SOP Class N-SET Request Attributes

entry.para: if not sent by SCU or invalid value received

row.entry: 1 - Max number of images for Display Format
Any pair of valid positive integers
Mandatory if sequence is present, no default
Mandatory if sequence is present, no default

formalpara.title: Magnification Type NONE defines Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior
formalpara.para: If the Image Box (or containing Film Box) attribute Magnification Type is NONE, the Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior is assumed to be CROP, ignoring the actual value of the Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior attribute provided by the Print SCU.

formalpara.title: Magnification Type NONE with Pixel Aspect Ration not 1:1
formalpara.para: The Pixel Aspect Ratio will always be considered even if the Image Box (or containing Film Box) attribute Magnification Type is NONE. In that case, only the number columns of the printed pixel matrix is identical with the number of columns of the received Image Data, and the number of rows of the printed pixel matrix will be adjusted according the Pixel Aspect Ratio.

formalpara.title: Requested Image Size defines Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior and ignores Magnification Type NONE
formalpara.para: If a Requested Image Size is provided by the Print SCU, the Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior is assumed to be DECIMATE, ignoring the actual value of the Requested Decimate/Crop Behavior attribute. Also, a provided Magnification Type of NONE will be replaced by BILINEAR in this case.

section.title: Specific Conformance to Basic Color Print Management Meta SOP Class
section.para: jPrint supports the following mandatory SOP classes as defined by the Basic Color Print Management Meta SOP Class:

table.title: SOP Classes for Basic Color Print Management Meta SOP Class

section.para: The specific SOP Conformance statement for Basic Color Print Management Meta SOP Class components which include the Basic Film Session, Basic Film Box, and Printer SOP Classes (which are also components of the Basic Grayscale Print Management Meta SOP Class) are described in .

note.para: Currently, there is no Standard Display Function for Hard- or Softcopies of Color Images defined by DICOM. Hence quality and consistency of color prints cannot be guaranteed by the usage of jPrint, but are dependent on the characteristic of the connected color printer(s).

section.title: Specific Conformance to Basic Annotation BOX SOP Class
section.para: jPrint creates the Basic Annotation Box SOP instance at the time the Basic Film Box SOP instance is created, based on the value of the Annotation Display Format ID (2010,0030) attribute of the Basic Film Box.
The created Basic Annotation Box SOP instance can be updated with the N-SET DIMSE service. The following table describes the attributes that can be updated:

table.title: Basic Annotation Box SOP Class N-SET Request Attributes

section.title: Specific Conformance for Presentation LUT Box SOP Class
section.para: jPrint supports the Presentation LUT SOP class as an SCP. Print SCUs may negotiate this support and create a Presentation LUT instance prior to the creation of Film Boxes or Image Boxes. Multiple Presentation LUT instances are supported in an association, but only one instance will be supported for each image.

The SCU shall send either the Presentation LUT Sequence or the Presentation LUT Shape. These values are mutually exclusive and the action will result in an error if neither or both are present. The presence of the Presentation LUT instance overrides any data set in the Configuration Information (2010,0150) attribute of the Film Box or Image Box.
jPrint provides support for the following DIMSE Services:

section.title: Presentation LUT Box SOP class operation for N-CREATE
section.para: jPrint supports the following attributes of the N-CREATE DIMSE Service of the Presentation LUT SOP Class:

table.title: Presentation LUT Box SOP N-CREATE Request Attributes

entry.para: if not sent by SCU or invalid value received

row.entry: Mandatory if no Presentation LUT Shape is present, no default.
Mandatory if sequence is present, no default.
Number of LUT entries = First value of LUT Descriptor
Mandatory if sequence is present, no default
Mandatory if no Presentation LUT Sequence is present, no default.

table.title: Presentation LUT Box SOP N-CREATE Response Status Handling Behavior

The N-SET operation is considered successful but the status meaning is logged.
An invalid attribute value was submitted
An instance of the Presentation LUT SOP Class already exists

section.title: Presentation LUT SOP class operation for N-DELETE
section.para: When a N-DELETE DIMSE service is requested with a specific Presentation LUT SOP Instance, jPrint will not delete the specified Presentation LUT SOP Instance as long as there are outstanding references to it. Otherwise, the specified Presentation LUT SOP Instance is deleted.

section.title: Consistent Presentation of Grayscale Images
section.para: jPrint supports the DICOM standard (PS 3-14) Grayscale Standard Display Function (GSDF) for Consistent Presentation of Displayed and Printed Images. The Image Consistency is achieved through the support of the Presentation LUT (transforming the image pixels value in to the Standard Presentation P-values) and then Transforming the Image pixel values from the standard Presentation (P-value) space to the Optical Density space.

jPrint supports calibration by manual measurements using a grayscale densitometer or semi-automatic calibration, that only requires the user to scan a current DSI 256 pattern print-out from the printer and a reference DSI 256 pattern page and put the resulting JPEG files into a configuration folder. The jPrint Service Manual describes the jPrint calibration of connected Printers to the DICOM GSDF curve in detail.

note.para: DICOM defines the usage of Presentation LUT SOP class only for Grayscale Print Management. jPrint supports usage of the Presentation LUT SOP Class also for Color Print Management: In the case of RGB image data, jPrint treat RGB pixel values with R=G=B like image pixels value in the MONCHROME case; but pass pixel values with different RGB sample values verbatim (=without applying P-LUT and/or GSDF) to the print driver.

section.title: Supported Communication Stacks
section.para: DICOM Upper Layer over TCP/IP is supported.

section.title: TCP/IP Stack
section.para: The TCP/IP stack is inherited from the underlying operating system.

section.title: Physical Network Interface
section.para: DICOM is indifferent to the physical medium over which TCP/IP executes.

section.title: Local AE Titles
section.para: Each connected printer must be bound to a different local AET. If no connected printer is bound to the Called AET in the Association Request of the Print SCU, only acceptance of the Presentation Context for Verification SOP Class will be returned in the Association Acceptance Response (A-ASSOCIATE-AC).

As a default, only one connected printer is configured:AE Title Configuration Table
Application EntityDefault AE TitleDefault TCP/IP Port
jPrintTIANI_PRINT6104

section.title: Remote AE Title
section.para: In the default configuration, Association Requests with any Calling AET will be accepted.

section.title: Parameters
section.para: A large number of parameters related to Print Management, Communications and general operation can be configured. The following table shows those configuration parameters relevant to DICOM communication. Refer to the jPrint Service Manual for details on general configuration capabilities.

table.title: Configuration Parameter Table

row.entry: Max PDU Send Size (If the receiver supports a smaller Max PDU Receive Size then the Max PDU Send Size will be reduced accordingly for the duration of the Association.)
Time-out to receive the Association Request (A-ASSOCIATE RQ), after accepting the TCP connect from the Print SCU.
Delay for TCP close after sending A-RELEASE RSP (or A-ABORT RQ) to the Print SCU.
Support for the Basic TLS Secure Transport Connection Profile
Certificate and private key for TLS authentication
Printer specific Parameters - may differ for connected Printers
Called AET associated with this Printer
Maximum number of Jobs in printer queue
Medium Type (if not specified by Print SCU)
Session Label (if not specified by Print SCU)
Orientation (if not specified by Print SCU)
Film Size ID (if not specified by Print SCU)
Magnification Type (if not specified by Print SCU)
Decimate Crop Behavior (if not specified by Print SCU)
Border Density (if not specified by Print SCU)
Trim (if not specified by Print SCU)
Illumination (if not specified by Print SCU)
Reflected Ambient Light (if not specified by Print SCU)
Configuration Information (if not specified by Print SCU)
Annotation Display Format (if not specified by Print SCU)
Resolution ID (if not specified by Print SCU)

section.title: Media Storage
section.para: jPrint does not support Media Storage.

section.title: Support of Extended Character Sets
section.para: jPrint supports ISO_IR 100 (ISO 8859-1 Latin 1) as an extended character set.

section.title: Security Profiles
section.para: jPrint can be configured to use secure DICOM communication in conformance with the Basic TLS Secure Transport Connection Profile.

section.title: Association Level Security
section.para: jPrint can be configured to accept Association Requests from only a limited list of Calling AE Titles and to check that the Association requester specifies the correct Called AE Title.

In the default configuration, Association requests with any Calling AET and any Called AET will be accepted. However, if no connected printer is configured for the Called AET, only acceptance of the Presentation Context for Verification SOP Class will be returned in the Association Acceptance Response (A-ASSOCIATE AC).

section.title: Created IOD Instances
section.para: jPrint creates the following IOD types of instances: Image Boxes, Annotation Boxes, Print Jobs, Printer, and Printer Configuration. The attributes of the created IODs are described in .

section.title: Used Fields in IOD by Application
section.para: The usage of attributes received in the IODs sent by the Print SCU is described in .

section.title: Attribute Mapping
section.para: The following table is a mapping of attributes that can be set by different Print IODs. If more than one IOD is setting the same element, then the value will be overwritten by the IOD's value in order shown, from left to right, such that the Printer Configuration (PC) specific element values that are in lowest order might be overwritten by another IOD.

table.title: jPrint Attribute Mapping

section.para:
Print Management IODs Abbreviations:PC
Printer ConfigurationFS
Film SessionFB
Film BoxIB
Image Box

section.title: Coerced/Modified Fields
section.para: jPrint will truncate attribute values received from the Print Composer (SCU) if the value length is longer than the maximum length permitted by the attribute VR.

section.title: Data Dictionary
section.para: No private attributes are defined.

section.title: Controlled Terminology
section.para: jPrint is not using any Codes (SNOMED) or Controlled Terminology, such as the use of the DICOM Content Mapping Resource (DCMR).

section.title: Gray Scale Standard Display Function
section.para: jPrint supports the Grayscale Standard Display Function (GSDF) as described in PS 3.14, for the Printer Calibration and Hardcopy Image Consistency.

section.title: Standard Extended/Specialized/Private SOPs
section.para: jPrint does not claim conformance to any Extended, Specialized, or Private SOP Classes.

section.title: Private Transfer Syntaxes
section.para: jPrint does not employ any Private Transfer Syntaxes.
